text: hello everyone
anyone here can help for complete my HubSpot developers CMS???tell me in step by step process???
out of curiosity why do you not want the email validation?

I believe it should say why you failed the practicum. (Not certain, i didn't need to retake).

You should then be able to make the adjustments and resubmit(there may be a time restriction for resubmitting too soon after the first attempt)

If it doesnt say what was done incorrectly reread all of the instructions and compare to the mockup

<@U3PKJ8EQL>

Hi <@ULF5GUVH7>, the instructions for the HubSpot CMS Developers practicum can be found here: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/practicum/cms-for-developers-certification>. You need to create a template in the HubSpot CMS that meets those requirements. I see you submitted the form, but it looks like the page you submitted is a wordpress site. Feel free to DM me if you have more questions. Thanks!

What's the best practice for launching an additional blog?  I'm hoping to add a couple more blogs to my site in French and German, but my template is going to take a fair bit of tweaking, and I'd rather not have them live while editing
If you did have them live, you could always use the robots.txt and add an entry to disallow it for the duration of the build. Then when its ready, remove the entry and link to it
It's looking more and more like this is the way to go
I was wondering about working in a dev portal and moving it over, but that seems like more of a headache than robots.txt
lol... next question.  Any idea why `{{ content.post_list_summary_featured_image }}` wouldn't be working when I have a featured image set on the blog post?
because it isnt a good picture and HubSpot is trying to help you save face?
Nevermind...
did it start working?
yeah, I chose a better picture and boom
:upside_down_face:
(also selected the checkbox to show featured images in summary listing)
ha!  that would have been my next guess
this conversation is gold
:tophat:

Hi! Anyone knows if it's possible to override RTE's links defaulting to relative if page is hosted in HS, even if link is set to "URL" and absolute url is used (this without having to edit in the RTE source code)? --- Use case: editors write event description in a RTE field, likely including the original event page; this description is then passed to "add to calendar links/files", but since it's defaulting to relative path, the link is broken; expert editors will fix this in the source code if they remember, but most won't...
<@U3PKJ8EQL> thanks i will try . And again need your help if im not qualified.
